title: AGT judge Lucy Durack, 36, gives birth to a son - as she announces his very traditional name
text:
Australia's Got Talent judge Lucy Durack, 36, has given birth to her second child - a baby boy.

The musical theatre star welcomed her bundle of joy with choreographer husband Chris Horsey, 47, earlier this month.

Speaking to New Idea magazine on Monday, Lucy said she was filled with love and relief after the safe delivery of her bub on October 8.

'He is healthy and doing well': AGT judge Lucy Durack, 36, (pictured) has given birth to a baby boy called Theodore Lindsay

'I feel a lot of happiness and love, as well as relief that he is here and that he is healthy and doing well,' she told the publication.

The couple also share a daughter, Polly, 4.

Lucy delivered her baby via C-section, and the couple gave him a traditional name - Theodore Lindsay.

'We're just in this little bubble now where it's all about Theodore - changing him, feeding him and cuddling him,' Lucy told the publication.

Expanding brood: Lucy and husband Christopher (L) already share a daughter Polly, 4

When it came to naming their new son, Lucy revealed that Lindsay was her grandfather's name.

She explained he had been a very special person in her life and the pair had always shared a strong connection.

Lucy revealed she was pregnant with her second child in May, prior to filming the Australia's Got Talent reboot.

Romance: Lucy has been married to to entertainer Christopher Horsey for the past 12 years

The talented star will return to the stage later this year, to take on the role of Princess Fiona in Shriek the Musical.

Lucy is best known for playing Glinda the Good Witch in the highly acclaimed version of Wicked on the stage.

She has slowly been moving onto the small screen, her appearing alongside Magda Szubanski and Barry Otto in the Netflix drama Sisters.

She married to fellow entertainer Christopher after the pair met almost 12 years ago at a theatre.
